questions.question: What do we remember on ANZAC Day?

choices.answer: The landing of the Australian and New Zealand Army corps at Gallipoli.
The arrival of the first settlers from Great Britain
The landing of the First Fleet at Sydney Cove

questions.question: Which of these statements about Australia's system of government is correct?

choices.answer: The Queen of Australia chooses people to form the Australian Parliament
The government is elected by the people
The Prime Minister chooses our Members of Parliament

questions.question: Which of these is an example of freedom of speech?

choices.answer: People can peacefully protest against government decisions
Men and women are treated equally in a court of law
Australians are free to not follow a religion

questions.question: Which of these statements about government in Australia is correct?

choices.answer: The government does not allow some religions
Government in Australia is secular
Religious laws are passed by parliment

questions.question: Which of these is a responsibility of Australian citizens aged 18 years or over

choices.answer: To have a current Australian Passport
To attend local council meetings
To vote in elections

questions.question: Which of these statements about voting in Australian elections is correct?

choices.answer: Voting is by a show of hands
People are free and safe to vote for any candidate
People must write their name on their vote

questions.question: What happened in Australia on 1 January 1901?

choices.answer: The Australian Constitution came into effect
The Australian Constitution was changed by a referendum
The Australian and New Zealand Army Corps was formed

questions.question: Which of these is a role of the Governor-General?

choices.answer: The appointment of the Head of State
The appointment of the state premiers
The signing of Bills passed in Australian Parliament

questions.question: What is the name of a proposal to make a law in Parliament?

choices.answer: Bill
Debate
Royal Assent

questions.question: Who maintains peace and order in Australia?

choices.answer: Lawyers
Police
Public servents
